title: randomly crashes without exiting firefox (must kill)
content:
hello

context :

Im using 78.10.0esr on debian 10

symptoms :

randomly while changing tab or opening a new one, all the firefox window content disappear but edges (all even tabs or scroll bars). but firefox do not crash - it doesn't exit but becomes unusable.

first investigations reveal it is always the same kind of errors in terminal :

https://pastebin.com/GV7WVnuF https://pastebin.com/GV7WVnuF

I don't understand how to fix that.

title: Disable "This Connection is not Secure" warning
content:
Is there a way to remove the box which contains

This Connection is not Secure?

It is extremely annoying to the point where it makes FF unusuable for some tasks

If a device is on a LAN (covered by RFC1918) then the option to turn the alerts off could be nice,

I have tried setting the following to false with no success.

security.insecure_field_warning.contextual.enabled signon.autofillForms.http
creator: completebellends

title: Pocket recommended stories are gone
content: I'm using firefox for quite a while now. And all the time there were those pocket recommendations on my about:newtab. But for one or two weeks now, they are gone. I have no option in the about:preferences#home page, to re-enable it. Can you help me getting it back?
creator: MisterSilvereagle

title: Firefox connection problem
content: I tend to have a lot of tabs open when I am doing any research usually 75 to 100 tabs with 3 pinned. This presents no issues at all such as freezing or going slow or closing the browser. However upon opening Firefox when I have 75 plus tabs, it wont connect or load the tabs for 2 or 3 minutes. I have the option set to only load the 3 pinned tabs on start up and the contents of any other tab is not loaded until I click on that tab. The 3 pinned tabs and any other tab I click on, will try to load but nothing happens then 2/3 minutes later, they will connect and everything is fine until the next time I close it & reopen. I can connect with any other browser or service whilst firefox is trying to load on opening but it is only firefox that has the issue. Is there another setting in about:config I need to change/increase to prevent this?
creator: samdell

title: Two instances of firefox installed. One to disable automatic updates
content:
I have normal firefox and beta version installed on a windows 10 machine in different directories. I want to disable automatic updates for the normal firefox but keep automatic updates for beta firefox enabled. When using the "DisableAppUpdate" registry setting/admx setting, it disables automatic updates for both. How can I set them separately?

kind regards Marc

content:

creator: slipystream45

title: Firefox upgraded — lost everything — can't find old profile data...used help docs
content:
I'm running MacOs Catalina, 10.15.7.

Firefox auto-updated on a restart. When I clicked it open, everything was gone. Bookmarks, tabs, add-ons, etc.

I looked in profiles and there are three folders, with gobbledygook names. The contents of each seem unique to one another, so I don't think one is the old profile and another is new, simply because the file titles would be the same — right?

I deleted one and restarted, and Firefox recreated it. Everything was still gone.

I looked in "About:Profiles" and there are two. I made both the default and restarted, same results. Everything still missing.

Is it possible that Firefox just got rid of the old profiles on the upgrade?

Is there another place it could be hiding?

Hoping for a miracle here. Thanks
creator: jroberts.ideas

title: Firefox, erro do sistema
content: Aparece isso pra mim como mostra a imagem, mas eu ja reinstalei e mesmo assim não deu certo.
creator: tiagoU_U

title: Failure to read configuration file because of enable_sandbox.
content:
I was trying to set a local file as a new tab, and followed a guide online. I put the autoconfig.js and the firefox.cfg files all in the right place, but it didn't work. When closed and reopened the browser, it said "Failed to read the configuration file. Please contact your system administrator." I figured out that the very last line: 

pref("general.config.sandbox_enabled", false);

was causing it to say that. How do I fix this?
creator: robert_phan
